title: [Large-Scale] Science Instructional Design Workshop Utilizing Generative AI-Based Self-Regulated Learning (SRL)

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of basic science education theories and understanding of digital learning environments
context.additional_context: Practical-centered training for pre-service/in-service teachers on leveraging AI tools to promote self-regulated learning in science classrooms

learning_goals: Learners develop the ability to design three or more self-regulated learning strategies using a generative AI chatbot (SRLbot).
Learners can conceptualize an AI-based personalized feedback system integrated with science learning content.

Learners can design a formative assessment tool prototype in digital environments (e.g., LMS, MOOC platforms) to measure motivation and behavioral engagement of 20-something undergraduates, including five or more behavioral indicators (e.g., login frequency, content interaction time), and achieve over 80% suitability scores in peer reviews and expert evaluations.

resources: Access to Generative AI Chatbot Platform

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
